gui

Class Panels

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Panels

  • public class Panels
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doConnections()
      Connects to facebook, twitter and email and adds info, when successfully connected, to a json file.
      void emailPanel(java.lang.String from, java.lang.String subject, java.lang.String content)
      Panel to view emails we choose in infoPanel.
      void facebookPanel(java.lang.String content)
      Panel to view a post we choose in infoPanel and comment if we want to
      javax.swing.JMenuBar getMenuBar(javax.swing.JPanel atualPanel)
      App menu bar, this menu has the option to change the panels.
      void infoPanel()
      Panel that has the table with emails, posts, and tweets.
      void loginPanel()
      First app panel, in this panel we can login or register a new account
      void registerPanel()
      Register panel, in this panel we must choose an email, username and password for our app.
      void startPanel()
      First panel after login, in this panel we have some information of the user and some shorcuts
      void twitterPanel(java.lang.String content)
      Panel to view a tweet we choose in infoPanel and retweet if we want to
      void xmlPanel()
      Panel with password, if password is correct we can see the content of config.xml and we can edit and save the changes of this file.

        Panels constructor
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • loginPanel

        public void loginPanel()
        First app panel, in this panel we can login or register a new account

      • registerPanel

        public void registerPanel()
        Register panel, in this panel we must choose an email, username and password for our app. We must choose a password for the email and API twitter keys.

      • getMenuBar

        public javax.swing.JMenuBar getMenuBar(javax.swing.JPanel atualPanel)
        App menu bar, this menu has the option to change the panels.
        Parameters:
        atualPanel - panel to hide and insert a new one
        Returns:
        JMenuBar returns a JMenuBar to insert in all panels

      • doConnections

        public void doConnections()
        Connects to facebook, twitter and email and adds info, when successfully connected, to a json file. Sorts the information by date

      • startPanel

        public void startPanel()
        First panel after login, in this panel we have some information of the user and some shorcuts

      • infoPanel

        public void infoPanel()
        Panel that has the table with emails, posts, and tweets. This panel has the option to filter the table information.

      • emailPanel

        public void emailPanel(java.lang.String from,
                       java.lang.String subject,
                       java.lang.String content)
        Panel to view emails we choose in infoPanel. This panel has the option to send emails.
        Parameters:
        from - String with the sender's email of the email selected if this string is null this attribute changes to "send to" to insert the email we want to send.
        subject - String with the email's subject we selected or we want to send
        content - String with the email's content we selected or we want to send.

      • facebookPanel

        public void facebookPanel(java.lang.String content)
        Panel to view a post we choose in infoPanel and comment if we want to
        Parameters:
        content - String with post content

      • twitterPanel

        public void twitterPanel(java.lang.String content)
        Panel to view a tweet we choose in infoPanel and retweet if we want to
        Parameters:
        content - String with post content

      • xmlPanel

        public void xmlPanel()
        Panel with password, if password is correct we can see the content of config.xml and we can edit and save the changes of this file.
